data.title: Request hearing with a judge
data.meta_description: If you don't agree with our response to your reconsideration, request a hearing with a judge.
data.text:
Request a hearing with an administrative law judge if you don't agree with our response to your reconsideration.

Request disability hearing

The hearing will take place in a video meeting online, in person, or by phone. The judge will review the evidence you provide with your request and ask questions about your medical condition. Medical experts and other witnesses may be asked to testify.

Request non-medical hearing

The hearing will take place in a video meeting online, in person, or by phone. The judge will ask why you requested a hearing and may want more evidence related to the issue.

Other ways to complete this task

Fax or mail us a request for a hearing with a judge

Fill out Request for Hearing by Administrative Law Judge (PDF). Then, find the Social Security office closest to your home and fax or mail us the completed form.

For support completing this task

Call us

Available in most U.S. time zones Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m., in English, Spanish, and other languages.

Call +1 800-772-1213

Tell the representative you want to request a hearing with a judge.

Call TTY +1 800-325-0778 if you're deaf or hard of hearing.

After you submit a request

You can expect a similar process for both disability hearings and non-medical hearings. Check the status of your hearing request and learn more about the hearing process.
